case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Near complete or complete skeleton
case_circumstances: On 03/17/2015, a passerby was walking in the area of Lone Mountain, near the Lone Mountain Cemetery (Carson City, Nevada), when he observed the decedent's tennis shoe sticking out of an apparent shallow grave.  Emergency personnel responded to the scene, used a knife to cut the shoe, and observed that the decedent's foot was inside of the shoe.  Emergency personnel excavated the decedent from a shallow grave.  The decedent was fully clothed, and skeletonized with attached tissue.
fingerprints: Fingerprint information is currently not available
case_clothing_on_body: Long-sleeve camo-print thermal type shirt (Size Medium, "Faded Glory," 38-40); logoed t-shirt (1998 NCAA, Final Four, San Antonio, Boise, Idaho); white lace bra; loose gray elastic waist band sweat pants (Size Large 36-38); dark colored cargo pants "Faded Glory Quality Goods, Size 10, 100 % cotton"; white stretch socks; adult disposable diaper.
case_footwear: Silver/white and purple tennis shoes (Asics Gel-Frantic 4, Size 7)
case_jewelry: On left ring finger, twisted gold colored metallic ring with an iridescent opal-like stone; on the right ring finger, a white metal ring, with a plastic or leather-like band affixed to the outside.
case_other_items_with_body: The decedent was wrapped in a green nylon-type sleeping bag; thick woven blanket;
dental: Dental information / charting is available and entered
documents: There are currently no documents available for this case.
